1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 module.exports = function(AV) {
  6   /**
  7    * Contains functions to deal with Status in AVOS Cloud.
  8    * @name AV.Status
  9    * @namespace
 10    */
 11   AV.Status = function(imageUrl, message) {
 12     this.data = {};
 13     this.inboxType = 'default';
 14     this.query = null;
 15     if(imageUrl && typeof imageUrl === 'object') {
 16         this.data = imageUrl;
 17     } else {
 18       if(imageUrl){
 19         this.data.image = imageUrl;
 20       }
 21       if(message){
 22         this.data.message = message;
 23       }
 24     }
 25     return this;
 26   };
 27 
 28   AV.Status.prototype = {
 29     /**
 30      * Gets the value of an attribute in status data.
 31      * @param {String} attr The string name of an attribute.
 32      */
 33     get: function(attr){
 34       return this.data[attr];
 35     },
 36     /**
 37      * Sets a hash of model attributes on the status data.
 38      * @param {String} key The key to set.
 39      * @param {} value The value to give it.
 40      */
 41     set: function(key, value){
 42       this.data[key] = value;
 43       return this;
 44     },
 45     /**
 46      * Destroy this status,then it will not be avaiable in other user's inboxes.
 47      * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
 48      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
 49      *     has finished.
 50      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
 51      *     completes.
 52      */
 53     destroy: function(options){
 54       if(!this.id)
 55         return AV.Promise.error('The status id is not exists.')._thenRunCallbacks(options);
 56       var request = AV._request("statuses", null, this.id, 'DELETE');
 57       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
 58     },
 59     /**
 60       * Cast the AV.Status object to an AV.Object pointer.
 61       * @return {AV.Object} A AV.Object pointer.
 62       */
 63     toObject: function(){
 64       if(!this.id)
 65           return null;
 66       return AV.Object.createWithoutData('_Status', this.id);
 67     },
 68     _getDataJSON: function() {
 69       var json = AV._.clone(this.data);
 70       return AV._encode(json);
 71     },
 72    /**
 73     * Send  a status by a AV.Query object.
 74     * <p>For example,send a status to male users:<br/><pre>
 75     *     var status = new AVStatus('image url', 'a message');
 76     *     status.query = new AV.Query('_User');
 77     *     status.query.equalTo('gender', 'male');
 78     *     status.send().then(function(){
 79     *              //send status successfully.
 80     *      }, function(err){
 81     *             //an error threw.
 82     *             console.dir(err);
 83     *      });
 84     * </pre></p>
 85     * @since 0.3.0
 86     * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
 87     *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
 88     *     has finished.
 89     * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the send
 90     *     completes.
 91     */
 92     send: function(options){
 93       if(!AV.User.current()){
 94         throw 'Please signin an user.';
 95       }
 96       if(!this.query){
 97         return AV.Status.sendStatusToFollowers(this, options);
 98       }
 99 
100       var query = this.query.toJSON();
101       query.className = this.query.className;
102       var data = {};
103       data.query = query;
104       this.data = this.data || {};
105       var currUser =  AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', AV.User.current().id)._toPointer();
106       this.data.source =  this.data.source || currUser;
107       data.data = this._getDataJSON();
108       data.inboxType = this.inboxType || 'default';
109 
110       var request = AV._request('statuses', null, null, 'POST', data);
111       var self = this;
112       return request.then(function(response){
113         self.id = response.objectId;
114         self.createdAt = AV._parseDate(response.createdAt);
115         return self;
116       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
117     },
118 
119     _finishFetch: function(serverData){
120         this.id = serverData.objectId;
121         this.createdAt = AV._parseDate(serverData.createdAt);
122         this.updatedAt = AV._parseDate(serverData.updatedAt);
123         this.messageId = serverData.messageId;
124         delete serverData.messageId;
125         delete serverData.objectId;
126         delete serverData.createdAt;
127         delete serverData.updatedAt;
128         this.data = AV._decode(undefined, serverData);
129     }
130   };
131 
132   /**
133    * Send  a status to current signined user's followers.For example:
134    * <p><pre>
135    *     var status = new AVStatus('image url', 'a message');
136    *     AV.Status.sendStatusToFollowers(status).then(function(){
137    *              //send status successfully.
138    *      }, function(err){
139    *             //an error threw.
140    *             console.dir(err);
141    *      });
142    * </pre></p>
143    * @since 0.3.0
144    * @param {AV.Status} status  A status object to be send to followers.
145    * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
146    *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
147    *     has finished.
148    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the send
149    *     completes.
150    */
151   AV.Status.sendStatusToFollowers = function(status, options) {
152     if(!AV.User.current()){
153       throw 'Please signin an user.';
154     }
155     var query = {};
156     query.className = '_Follower';
157     query.keys = 'follower';
158     var currUser =  AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', AV.User.current().id). _toPointer();
159     query.where = {user: currUser};
160     var data = {};
161     data.query = query;
162     status.data = status.data || {};
163     status.data.source =  status.data.source || currUser;
164     data.data = status._getDataJSON();
165     data.inboxType = status.inboxType || 'default';
166 
167     var request = AV._request('statuses', null, null, 'POST', data);
168     return request.then(function(response){
169       status.id = response.objectId;
170       status.createdAt = AV._parseDate(response.createdAt);
171       return status;
172     })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
173   };
174 
175   /**
176    * <p>Send  a status from current signined user to other user's private status inbox.</p>
177    * <p>For example,send a private status to user '52e84e47e4b0f8de283b079b':<br/>
178    * <pre>
179    *    var status = new AVStatus('image url', 'a message');
180    *     AV.Status.sendPrivateStatus(status, '52e84e47e4b0f8de283b079b').then(function(){
181    *              //send status successfully.
182    *      }, function(err){
183    *             //an error threw.
184    *             console.dir(err);
185    *      });
186    * </pre></p>
187    * @since 0.3.0
188    * @param {AV.Status} status  A status object to be send to followers.
189    * @param {} target The target user or user's objectId.
190    * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
191    *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
192    *     has finished.
193    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the send
194    *     completes.
195    */
196   AV.Status.sendPrivateStatus = function(status, target, options) {
197     if(!AV.User.current()){
198       throw 'Please signin an user.';
199     }
200     if(!target){
201           throw "Invalid target user.";
202     }
203     var userObjectId = _.isString(target) ? target: target.id;
204     if(!userObjectId){
205         throw "Invalid target user.";
206     }
207 
208     var query = {};
209     query.className = '_User';
210     var currUser =  AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', AV.User.current().id). _toPointer();
211     query.where = {objectId: userObjectId};
212     var data = {};
213     data.query = query;
214     status.data = status.data || {};
215     status.data.source =  status.data.source || currUser;
216     data.data = status._getDataJSON();
217     data.inboxType = 'private';
218     status.inboxType = 'private';
219 
220     var request = AV._request('statuses', null, null, 'POST', data);
221     return request.then(function(response){
222       status.id = response.objectId;
223       status.createdAt = AV._parseDate(response.createdAt);
224       return status;
225     })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
226   };
227 
228   /**
229    * Count unread statuses in someone's inbox.For example:<br/>
230    * <p><pre>
231    *  AV.Status.countUnreadStatuses(AV.User.current()).then(function(response){
232    *    console.log(response.unread); //unread statuses number.
233    *    console.log(response.total);  //total statuses number.
234    *  });
235    * </pre></p>
236    * @since 0.3.0
237    * @param {Object} source The status source.
238    * @return {AV.Query} The query object for status.
239    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the count
240    *     completes.
241    */
242   AV.Status.countUnreadStatuses = function(owner){
243     if(!AV.User.current() && owner == null){
244       throw 'Please signin an user or pass the owner objectId.';
245     }
246     owner = owner || AV.User.current();
247     var options = !_.isString(arguments[1]) ? arguments[1] : arguments[2];
248     var inboxType =  !_.isString(arguments[1]) ? 'default' : arguments[1];
249     var params = {};
250     params.inboxType = AV._encode(inboxType);
251     params.owner = AV._encode(owner);
252     var request = AV._request('subscribe/statuses/count', null, null, 'GET', params);
253     return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
254   };
255 
256   /**
257    * Create a status query to find someone's published statuses.For example:<br/>
258    * <p><pre>
259    *   //Find current user's published statuses.
260    *   var query = AV.Status.statusQuery(AV.User.current());
261    *   query.find().then(function(statuses){
262    *      //process statuses
263    *   });
264    * </pre></p>
265    * @since 0.3.0
266    * @param {Object} source The status source.
267    * @return {AV.Query} The query object for status.
268    */
269   AV.Status.statusQuery = function(source){
270     var query = new AV.Query('_Status');
271     if(source){
272       query.equalTo('source', source);
273     }
274     return query;
275   };
276 
277    /**
278     * <p>AV.InboxQuery defines a query that is used to fetch somebody's inbox statuses.</p>
279     * @see AV.Status#inboxQuery
280     * @class
281     */
282    AV.InboxQuery = AV.Query._extend(/** @lends AV.InboxQuery.prototype */{
283      _objectClass: AV.Status,
284      _sinceId: 0,
285      _maxId:  0,
286      _inboxType: 'default',
287      _owner: null,
288      _newObject: function(){
289       return new AV.Status();
290     },
291     _createRequest: function(params){
292       return AV._request("subscribe/statuses", null, null, "GET",
293                                    params || this.toJSON());
294     },
295 
296 
297     /**
298      * Sets the messageId of results to skip before returning any results.
299      * This is useful for pagination.
300      * Default is zero.
301      * @param {Number} n the mesage id.
302      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
303      */
304     sinceId: function(id){
305       this._sinceId = id;
306       return this;
307     },
308     /**
309      * Sets the maximal messageId of results。
310      * This is useful for pagination.
311      * Default is zero that is no limition.
312      * @param {Number} n the mesage id.
313      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
314      */
315     maxId: function(id){
316       this._maxId = id;
317       return this;
318     },
319     /**
320      * Sets the owner of the querying inbox.
321      * @param {Object} owner The inbox owner.
322      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
323      */
324     owner: function(owner){
325       this._owner = owner;
326       return this;
327     },
328     /**
329      * Sets the querying inbox type.default is 'default'.
330      * @param {Object} owner The inbox type.
331      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
332      */
333     inboxType: function(type){
334       this._inboxType = type;
335       return this;
336     },
337     toJSON: function(){
338       var params = AV.InboxQuery.__super__.toJSON.call(this);
339       params.owner = AV._encode(this._owner);
340       params.inboxType = AV._encode(this._inboxType);
341       params.sinceId = AV._encode(this._sinceId);
342       params.maxId = AV._encode(this._maxId);
343       return params;
344     }
345    });
346 
347   /**
348    * Create a inbox status query to find someone's inbox statuses.For example:<br/>
349    * <p><pre>
350    *   //Find current user's default inbox statuses.
351    *   var query = AV.Status.inboxQuery(AV.User.current());
352    *   //find the statuses after the last message id
353    *   query.sinceId(lastMessageId);
354    *   query.find().then(function(statuses){
355    *      //process statuses
356    *   });
357    * </pre></p>
358    * @since 0.3.0
359    * @param {Object} owner The inbox's owner
360    * @param {String} inboxType The inbox type,'default' by default.
361    * @return {AV.InboxQuery} The inbox query object.
362    * @see AV.InboxQuery
363    */
364   AV.Status.inboxQuery = function(owner, inboxType){
365     var query = new AV.InboxQuery(AV.Status);
366     if(owner){
367       query._owner = owner;
368     }
369     if(inboxType){
370       query._inboxType = inboxType;
371     }
372     return query;
373   };
374 
375 };
376
